point d'orgue 2020

Points d'orgue is a sound collection of memories that took place in the middle east.

It gathers intimate topographies, in which its past, current and transient inhabitants revisit a story in time.

These stories will be transmitted through the glass facade of the gallery, calling the attention of curious ears passing by.

sound installation by farah hazim & wissam sader

The installation can be experienced every day from 13-25 june 20, between 4-10 pm.

This marks the first event of the project Where Have All the Jasmines Gone? curated by Charlotte Bank and Salah Saouli.
